pt: {sc}abstracted{/sc} {sc}preoccupied{/sc} {sc}absent{/sc} {sc}absent-minded{/sc} {sc}distracted{/sc} mean inattentive to what claims or demands consideration. {sc}abstracted{/sc} implies absorption of the mind in something other than one's surroundings, and often suggests reflection on weighty matters.
{sc}preoccupied{/sc} often implies having one's attention so taken up by thoughts as to neglect others.

pt.t: too {it}preoccupied{/it} with her debts to enjoy the meal

pt: {sc}absent{/sc} stresses inability to fix the mind on present concerns due more to mental wandering than to concentration on other matters.
{sc}absent-minded{/sc} implies that the mind is fixed elsewhere and often refers to a habit of abstractedness.

pt.t: so {it}absent-minded{/it}, he's been known to wear mismatched shoes

pt: {sc}distracted{/sc} may suggest an inability to concentrate caused by worry, sorrow, or anxiety.

pt.t: was too {it}distracted{/it} by grief to continue working
